description.narrative: To design and implement a public sector management reform program aimed at improving: (a) budgetary and public expenditure management systems and processes; and (b) civil service and public administration performance.

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not tracked as absent an HRMIS the use of the census was not clear.
A civil service census was completed in 2007. However, it is unclear what purpose this served as there was no HRMIS in place at thetime to make use of the data

title.narrative: Key reports on agency performance available to the public

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not tracked as it is not linked to project activities

title.narrative: Feedbacl on public service delivery surveys on organizational performance made public

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not tracked as it was not linked to activities funded in the project

title.narrative: Greater satisfaction among users of services with organizational performanceand integrity

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not tracked as it was not linked to activities funded in the project

title.narrative: Less deviation between projected and actual personnel costs

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not tracked in regular ISRs as this was not a major problem in Mongolia
Achieved. GFMIS has enhanced fiscal controls and personnel expenditures are generally within budget limits

title.narrative: Development of pilot regulations for organizational and individual performance evaluation

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not tracked in the ISRs as it is not particularly meaningful
Achieved

title.narrative: Results based monitoring framework in selected ministries adopted

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not tracked

title.narrative: Sector MTEF reflect recommendations for Country Gender Assessments

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not used as it is not very clear
Not achieved
Original PAD indicator that was not used but is a good indicator of the impact of the GFMIS
Arrears are not a problem and are less than 1% of total expenditures

title.narrative: Procurement lead time reduced to below three months

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not used for monitoring as it is not linked to project activities
Achieved. But this has no implication on the quality of the procurement
Original PAD indicator that was not used in ISRs as overstaffing is not a problem in the civil service. On the contrary, keyministries are understaffed

title.narrative: Audit reports presented to parliament within period described by Law and decisions of parliament made public

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not used in regular ISR monitoring as it was not linked to project activities
Partially achieved. Audits are done on time but audit findings not regularly made public

title.narrative: More accurate medium term projection of staffing, needs, skills, costs aligned to MTEF

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicator that was not used
Not achieved as there is no functioning MTEF

title.narrative: Implementing rules and regulations for procurement law developed

comment.narrative: Original PAD indicators that was not used as it is not particularly meaningful
This has not been an issue in public procurement.

title.narrative: Budget execution reports available on a quarterly basis

comment.narrative: Original indicator that was not used. It is however a useful indicator on the effectiveness of the GFMIS
Monthly and quarterly budget execution reports have been prepared for quite some time

title.narrative: Credible sector ceilings for sector ministry budgets

comment.narrative: This is an original PAD indicator that has not been used. This however, is a good sub-indicator of the MTEF indicator
Sector ceilings, while distributed annually, are non-binding and are not credible as line ministry proposals exceed these bysignificant amounts

title.narrative: Budget ceilings shared with all cabinet members at most two months after start of budget process

comment.narrative: This is an original PAD indicator that has not been used.
MTFF approved June 1 and budget ceilings distributed July 1. This target has therefore been met.

title.narrative: Time elapsed between beginning of budget preparation and cabinet level involvement involvement is reduced to two months

comment.narrative: This was an original indicator in the PAD that was not used for monitoring during implementation since it is not linked to projectactivities
There are no issues of delays in budget preparation. The process begins in June 1 with the approval of MTFF, with submission ofbudget to cabinet on Sept 15.

title.narrative: Budget preparation process streamlined and clear timetable adopted

comment.narrative: This was an original indicator in the PAD that was not used for monitoring during implementation since it is not linked to projectactivities
There is a clear budget timetable in the Budget Law that is being implemented

title.narrative: Fully functional Government Financial Management Information System operating

baseline.value: Phase I of GFMIS hardware deployed under Fiscal Technical Assistance Project. However, Aimags and UB districts not connected

target.value: ACHIEVED: GFMIS connected to all Aimags and UB districts. Hardware for Soums delivered. System fully operational

comment.narrative: The PDO has been achived
This PDO has been achieved

title.narrative: Improved quality of data on civil servants, mproved compensation structure and HR performance management framework

baseline.value: Complex pay and grading structure that negatively impacts staff morale; significant political influence on certain key positionsthat results in high turnover of staff, particularly during the election cycle

target.value: Government resolution simplifying pay for the administrative service by merging several allowances into basic pay; salaryincreasesbased on findings of pay comparator surveys

comment.narrative: No progress to date on simplifying the pay structure or basing civil service pay increases to pay comparator surveys

title.narrative: Budget Preparation System implemented and fully functional

baseline.value: A simple internal built database called Fiscal used for budget preparation

comment.narrative: With operational acceptance in February 2013, and training of staff from December 2012 to May 2013, 2014 budget can commence onBPISin June 2013.
Failed. Only 60 percent of the core modules were deemed to have passed, against a target of 90 percent

title.narrative: Comprehensive MTFF implemented based on fiscal rules

baseline.value: Fiscal Framework Statement (FFS) resulting in procyclical fiscal policy; budget's prepared that do not adhere to targets in FFS

target.value: MTFF based on fiscal rules as defined in Fiscal Stability Law implemented for the 2013 budget

comment.narrative: The 2013 budget is pro-cyclical based on overly ambitious revenue targets. Significant off-budget spending by the DevelopmentBank,and through the Bank of Mongolia, violate the FSL in spirit.

title.narrative: A Human Resource Management Information System implemented and fully functional

baseline.value: Incomplete and fragment data on human resources and payroll which compromises HR planning and wage bill planning and execution

target.value: HRMIS in place, thereby providing information on payroll and postion management. Functional reviews for the MoF, MSWL, and MoEconducted

comment.narrative: Unlikely to be achieved

A functional design of a centralized payroll and HR database completed and accepted by CSC and MoF. Further software developmentissubject to available funding, either from the Government budget or other development partners

title.narrative: A system for appraising public investment projects developed

baseline.value: Minimal economic appraisal of public investment projects financed by the state budget

target.value: 2013 capital budget based on strengthened process established in the IBL

actual.value: Provisions in the IBL still to be implemented

comment.narrative: Limited capacity in the MoF and the planning ministry to implement IBL provisions in 2012

title.narrative: Sector MTEF's consistent with sector ceilings

comment.narrative: Not achieved as there is no functioning MTEF
Not achieved

title.narrative: Sector MTEF consistent with ceilings and policy priorities

comment.narrative: Not achieved. There is no functional MTEF in Mongolia

title.narrative: Internal audit mandate and internal audit methodology adopted
Development and implementation of a medium term civil service reform strategy

comment.narrative: Not achieved

title.narrative: Implementation of a strategic plan for institutional strengthening of the Civil Service Council

comment.narrative: Not achieved. No progress in strengthening the Civil Service Council
